attributes.name: UXS Button
attributes.description:
A component to render a simple button

{{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable this button.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: Set to true to enable the button to appear inline with other buttons or inline components. The button will use the inline-block display property.

arguments.name: loading
arguments.description:
Set to true if the button has already been pressed or should be disabled while another action takes place.

If the loadingText argument has been provided this will be displayed, defaults to "Loadingâ€¦".

This will activate it's loading style and also prevent any actions from being fired..

arguments.name: mini
arguments.description:
Deprecated

Use the size="small" argument instead.

arguments.name: naked
arguments.description: Strip away any background styles and just display the buttons text.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
Add a custom name to your button, used for aria labels & test selectors.

By default this will be the same as the text argument unless you parse a different value.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description:
Set's the button style to a selected state.

Can be used to toggle buttons or to infer an active state without disabling the buttons action.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
Set the size of the button. Default is medium.

UXS ships with the following stock sizes: giant, huge, large, medium, small, tiny.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-massive-size

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the button.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: text
arguments.description:
The buttons text, this can be set as the first positional parameter.

It will also default to the components name.

attributes.name: UXS Button Group
attributes.description:
A component to render group of buttons

{{#uxs-button-group
  align=align
  disabled=disabled
  padded=padded
  row=row
  style=style
  as |group|
}}
  {{group.button "Save" style="primary"}}
  {{group.button "Save & Publish" style="primary"}}
  {{group.link "Cancel" "docs.forms.buttons" style="warning"}}
{{/uxs-button-group}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-tabs'

arguments.name: align
arguments.description:
Set the alignment of the buttons. This will only take effect if the group is in column layout (row=false)

UXS ships with three align options: left, center (default) & right

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable all buttons in the group.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired and links working.

arguments.name: padded
arguments.description: Set to true to add some horizontal padding to the group

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: Set to true to display child buttons in a row instead of a column

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the groups background.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-tabs--my-custom-style

attributes.name: UXS Button Link
attributes.description:
A component to render a link as a simple button

{{uxs-button-link "BUTTON TEXT" "photos.edit" photo}}

{{#uxs-button-link "photos.edit" photo}}
  BUTTON TEXT
{{/uxs-button-link}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable this button.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: Set to true to enable the button to appear inline with other buttons or inline components. The button will use the inline-block display property.

arguments.name: mini
arguments.description:
Deprecated

Use the size="small" argument instead.

arguments.name: naked
arguments.description: Strip away any background styles and just display the buttons text.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
Add a custom name to your button, used for aria labels & test selectors.

By default this will be the same as the text argument unless you parse a different value.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
Set the size of the button. Default is medium.

UXS ships with the following stock sizes: giant, huge, large, medium, small, tiny.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-massive-size

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the button.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: text
arguments.description:
The buttons text, this can be set as the first positional parameter.

It will also default to the components name.

attributes.name: UXSContent
attributes.description:
A typographic component to render content text

{{uxs-content "Lorem ipsum dolar"}}

{{#uxs-content}}Lorem ipsum dolar"{{/uxs-content}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The BEM base name for this component: "content"

fields.name: testSelectorName
fields.description:
The test selector name defines the name of the [data-test-*] attribute binding
Default is "content"

fields.name: testSelectorValue
fields.description:
The base property is used as the value for test selectors.
_Default is the value of "name"

fields.name: layout
fields.description: The path to the handlbars template

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Adds a color modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret).

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the component. This property also defaults to the value for test selectors.

The default is true, which ensures the test selector is added. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description: Adds a style modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret).

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: Define the size of the component. Standard options are "giant", "huge", "large", "medium", "small", or "tiny". Defaults to no size (inhered)

arguments.name: text*
arguments.description:
The text to be rendered inside this component
This can be passed in as the first positional parameter

attributes.name: UXSDatalist
attributes.description:
Datalist used to display infomation in a read only format

{{#uxs-datalist as |list|}}
  {{list.item label="Label" value="Value"}}
{{/uxs-datalist}}}}

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The BEM base name for this component

arguments.name: bordered
arguments.description: If true, each data item will have a bottom border

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the component, will be used as the value for all test selectors. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the datalist component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-datalist--my-custom-style

attributes.name: UXSDatalistItem
attributes.description:
Datalist items display a lable and value of a property

{{#uxs-datalist as |list|}}
  {{list.item
    label=label
    value=value
    tip=tip
    empty=empty
  }}
{{/uxs-datalist}}

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The BEM base name for this component

arguments.name: label
arguments.description: A string to display as the label

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: A string to display as the value

arguments.name: tip
arguments.description: A string to display as the tooltip

arguments.name: empty
arguments.description: A string to show if the value is empty

arguments.name: bordered
arguments.description: If true, each data item will have a bottom border

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the component, will be used as the value for all test selectors. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the datalist component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-datalist--my-custom-style

attributes.name: UXSDetail

A typographic component to render detail text

{{uxs-detail "Lorem ipsum dolar"}}

{{#uxs-detail}}Lorem ipsum dolar"{{/uxs-detail}}

fields.name: testSelectorName

Default is "detail"

fields.name: testSelectorValue
fields.description:
The base property is used as the value for test selectors.
_Default is the value of "name"

fields.name: layout

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: color

arguments.name: name

attributes.name: UXSDL

A typographic component to render definition lists

{{#uxs-dl as |list|}}
  {{list.term "Coffee"}}
  {{list.description "Black hot drink"}}
  {{list.term "Milk"}}
  {{list.description "White cold drink"}}
{{/uxs-dl}}

attributes.name: UXSIcon
attributes.description:
Render either a font or svg icon.

{{#uxs-icon "check_circle"}}

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The BEM base name for this component

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-icon--my-custom-style

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable this component.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired and links working.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: Style the icon inline with sibling components.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
Set the size of the component. Default is medium.

UXS ships with the following stock sizes: giant, huge, large, medium, small, tiny.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-massive-size

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the component, will be used as the value for all test selectors. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

attributes.name: UXSListNotice
attributes.description:
Used in lists to highlight certain contexts. e.g. an active filter.

{{uxs-list as |list|}}
  {{list.notice text}}
{{/uxs-list}}

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The BEM base name for this component

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the component, will be used as the value for all test selectors. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: Sets the notices text string

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: If set the notice will contain an icon on the left

arguments.name: actionText
arguments.description: If set the notice will contain a action button on the right

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: onClick
arguments.description: This event is fired when the notice button is clicked. Requires actionText to be set. No params are set by default.

attributes.name: UXS List Subheading
attributes.description:
A component to render a list subheading component

{{uxs-list-subheading "My Subheading"}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-list__subheading'

arguments.name: bordered
arguments.description: Should the subheading have a border?

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the subheading component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-splash--my-custom-style

attributes.name: UXS List Subheading
attributes.description:
A component to render a list subheading component

{{#uxs-list as |list|}}
  {{list.subheading "My Subheading"}}
{{/uxs-list}}

{{#uxs-list as |list|}}
  {{#list.subheading as |subheading}}
    {{subheading.icon "add"}}
    {{subheading.text  "My Subheading"}}
    {{subheading.toggle value=toggled onToggle=(action (mut toggled))}}
  {{/list.subheading}}
{{/uxs-list}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-list__subheading'

arguments.name: bordered
arguments.description: Should the subheading have a border?

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the subheading component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-splash--my-custom-style

arguments.name: yield
arguments.description: Set this to true if you are using the yielded components.

attributes.name: UXSMenu
attributes.description:
Display lists of links and actions in a menu

{{#uxs-menu as |menu|}}
  {{menu.item "Maps"}}
  {{menu.item "Books"}}
  {{menu.item "Flights"}}
  {{menu.item "Apps"}}
{{/uxs-menu}}

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The BEM base name for this component

arguments.name: bordered
arguments.description: If true, the menu will include a border

arguments.name: horizontal
arguments.description: If true, the menu will be displayed horizontally

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. --my-custom-style

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: detail
arguments.description: If set to true the menu items will be rendered small (detail) size

arguments.name: hasLeftIcon
arguments.description: If set to true the menu items & links will include a left padding to account for icons.

arguments.name: hasRightIcon
arguments.description: If set to true the menu items & links will include a right padding to account for icons.

arguments.name: hasSecondaryText
arguments.description: If set to true the menu items & links will include padding to account for secondary text.

attributes.name: UXSMenu/Item
attributes.description:
Display link to another route within a uxs-menu

{{#uxs-menu as |menu|}}
  {{menu.item "My Action" onClick=(action "somthing")}}
{{/uxs-menu}}

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The BEM base name for this component

arguments.name: horizontal
arguments.description: If true, the link will be displayed horizontally

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. --my-custom-style

arguments.name: detail
arguments.description: If set to true the link will be rendered small (detail) size

arguments.name: hasLeftIcon
arguments.description: If set to true the link will include a left padding to account for icons.

arguments.name: hasRightIcon
arguments.description: If set to true the link will include a right padding to account for icons.

arguments.name: rightIcon
arguments.description: If set the link will contain an icon on the right

arguments.name: leftIcon
arguments.description: If set the link will contain an icon on the left

arguments.name: onClick
arguments.description: The name of the action to fire on click

arguments.name: role
arguments.description: Set a role to the item for accessibility

arguments.name: hasSecondaryText
arguments.description: If set to true the item will include padding to account for secondary text.

arguments.name: secondaryText
arguments.description: Sets secondary text in the item

attributes.name: UXSMenu/Link
attributes.description:
Display link to another route within a uxs-menu

{{#uxs-menu as |menu|}}
  {{menu.link "My Route" "route.name"}}
{{/uxs-menu}}

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The BEM base name for this component

arguments.name: horizontal
arguments.description: If true, the link will be displayed horizontally

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. --my-custom-style

arguments.name: detail
arguments.description: If set to true the link will be rendered small (detail) size

arguments.name: hasLeftIcon
arguments.description: If set to true the link will include a left padding to account for icons.

arguments.name: hasRightIcon
arguments.description: If set to true the link will include a right padding to account for icons.

arguments.name: rightIcon
arguments.description: If set the link will contain an icon on the right

arguments.name: leftIcon
arguments.description: If set the link will contain an icon on the left

arguments.name: hasSecondaryText
arguments.description: If set to true the link will include padding to account for secondary text.

arguments.name: secondaryText
arguments.description: Sets secondary text in the link

attributes.name: UXS Navbar
attributes.description:
A component to render a navigation bar

{{#uxs-navbar as |bar|}}
  {{#bar.menu as |nav|}}
    {{nav.item "Home"}}
    {{nav.item "Account"}}
    {{nav.item "Logout"}}
  {{/bar.menu}}
{{/uxs-navbar}}

arguments.name: toggleIcon
arguments.description: Define the menu icon that will toggle the offscreen menu

attributes.name: UXSOL
attributes.description:
A typographic component to render ordered lists

{#uxs-ol as |list|}}

  {{list.item "Item Two"}}
  {{#list.ol as |sublist|}}
    {{sublist.item "Item Three a"}}
    {{sublist.item "Item Three b"}}
  {{/list.ol}}
  {{list.item "Item Four"}}
{{/uxs-ol}}

fields.name: base

fields.name: layout
fields.description: The path to the handlbars template

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Adds a color modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret).

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the component. This property also defaults to the value for test selectors.

The default is true, which ensures the test selector is added. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description: Adds a style modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret).

arguments.description: Define the size of the component. Standard options are "giant", "huge", "large", "medium", "small", or "tiny". Defaults to no size (inhered)

attributes.name: UXSPaginationControls
attributes.description:
Used to provide controlls to change page or size of paginated data

{{uxs-pagination-controls
  size=model.meta.size
  page=model.meta.page
  total=model.meta.total
  style=style
  onChange=(action "paginateResults")
}}

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the component, will be used as the value for all test selectors. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The BEM base name for this component

arguments.name: resultsLabel
arguments.description: The text of the pagination label

arguments.name: countPrefix
arguments.description:
Add any text to the start of the "1 - 25 of 360" text.

e.g. "Showing 1 - 25 of 360"

arguments.name: countSuffix
arguments.description:
Add any text to the end of the "1 - 25 of 360" text.

e.g. "1 - 25 of 360 aliens"

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The size of a "page"

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: The index of the current page

arguments.name: total
arguments.description: The total number of records

arguments.name: onChange
arguments.description: This event is fired when the user changes the page size or the next and prev buttons are clicked

attributes.name: UXS Pane
attributes.description:
A component to render group of buttons

{{#uxs-pane}}
  ...Content
{{/uxs-pane}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-tabs'

arguments.name: aside
arguments.description: Set to true to display an aside style pane

arguments.name: detail
arguments.description: Set to true to display a detail style pane

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: Set to true to display an index style pane

arguments.name: main
arguments.description: Set to true to display a main style pane

arguments.name: order
arguments.description: Set the mobile order of the pane. 1 to 9 supported

arguments.name: padded
arguments.description: Set to true to add some padding to the pane

arguments.name: single
arguments.description: Set to true to display a single style pane

arguments.name: splash
arguments.description: Set to true to display a splash style pane

arguments.name: split
arguments.description: Set to true to display a split style pane

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the panes background.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-pane--my-custom-style

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Set the type of pane, an alternative to using the bolean arguments for main, aside etc

UXS ships with the following stock pane types: aside, detail, index, main, single, splash & split.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-pane--my-custom-type

attributes.name: UXS Splash
attributes.description:
A component to render a splash component

{{#uxs-splash as |splash|}}
  {{splash.icon "inbox"}}
  {{splash.title "Inbox Zero"}}
  {{splash.text "Congratulations, you have no more email!"}}
{{/uxs-splash}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-splash'

arguments.name: align
arguments.description:
Set the alignment of the splash component.

UXS ships with three align options: left, center (default) & right

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the splash component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-splash--my-custom-style

attributes.name: UXSSubheading
attributes.description:
A typographic component to render subheading text

{{uxs-subheading "Lorem ipsum dolar"}}

{{#uxs-subheading}}Lorem ipsum dolar"{{/uxs-subheading}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The BEM base name for this component: "subheading"

fields.name: testSelectorName
fields.description:
The test selector name defines the name of the [data-test-*] attribute binding
Default is "subheading"

fields.name: testSelectorValue
fields.description:
The base property is used as the value for test selectors.
_Default is the value of "name"

fields.name: layout
fields.description: The path to the handlbars template

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Adds a color modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret).

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the component. This property also defaults to the value for test selectors.

The default is true, which ensures the test selector is added. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description: Adds a style modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret).

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: Define the size of the component. Standard options are "giant", "huge", "large", "medium", "small", or "tiny". Defaults to no size (inhered)

arguments.name: text*
arguments.description:
The text to be rendered inside this component
This can be passed in as the first positional parameter

attributes.name: UXSTable
attributes.description:
A table component to render data

{{#uxs-table as |table|}}
  {{#table.row as |row|}}
    {{row.heading "Food"}}
    {{row.heading "Caloires (g)" numeric=true}}
  {{/table.row}}
  {{#table.row section=true as |row|}}
    {{row.cell "Frozen yoghurt"}}
    {{row.cell "159" numeric=true}}
  {{/table.row}}
{{/uxs-table}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The BEM base name for this component: "uxs-text"

fields.name: layout
fields.description: The path to the handlbars template

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Adds a color modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret).

arguments.name: fullWidth
arguments.description: Stretch table to full width

arguments.name: padding
arguments.description: Add some vertical padding to the table

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the component. This property also defaults to the value for test selectors.

The default is true, which ensures the test selector is added. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: record
arguments.description: Style the table as a record table

arguments.name: style
arguments.description: Adds a style modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret).

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: Define the size of the component. Standard options are "giant", "huge", "large", "medium", "small", or "tiny". Defaults to no size (inhered)

attributes.name: UXS Tabs
attributes.description:
A component to render a tab menu

{{#uxs-tabs style=style as |tab|}}
  {{tab.link "Dog" "foo"}}
  {{tab.link "Cat" "bar"}}
  {{tab.item "fish" "foo" onClick(action "foobar")}}
{{/uxs-tabs}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-tabs'

arguments.name: align
arguments.description:
Set the alignment of the tabs items.

UXS ships with three align options: left, center (default) & right

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable the whole tab menu.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired and links working.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the tab menu.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-tabs--my-custom-style

attributes.name: UXS Tabs Item
attributes.description:
A contextual component to render a tab item

{{uxs-tabs/item "fish" onClick(action "foobar")}}

{{#uxs-tabs style=style as |tab|}}
  {{tab.item "fish" onClick(action "foobar")}}
{{/uxs-tabs}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-tabs__item'

arguments.name: align
arguments.description:
Set the alignment of the tab item.

UXS ships with three align options: left, center (default) & right

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable the tab item.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any action from being fired.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the tab item.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-tabs--my-custom-style

arguments.name: title
arguments.description:
The title text of the item

This argment is passed in as positional parameter 1

attributes.name: UXS Tabs Link
attributes.description:
A contextual component to render a tab link item

{{uxs-tabs/link "fish" "foo" model.id}}

{{#uxs-tabs style=style as |tab|}}
  {{tab.link "fish" "foo" model.id}}
{{/uxs-tabs}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-tabs__item'

arguments.name: align
arguments.description:
Set the alignment of the tab link item.

UXS ships with three align options: left, center (default) & right

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable the tab link item.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any action from being fired.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the tab link item.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-tabs--my-custom-style

arguments.name: title
arguments.description:
The title text of the link item

This argment is passed in as positional parameter 1 if not rendered in block format

attributes.name: UXSUL
attributes.description:
A typographic component to render ordered lists

{#uxs-ul as |list|}}
  {{list.item "Item One"}}
  {{list.item "Item Two"}}
  {{#list.ul as |sublist|}}
    {{sublist.item "Item Three a"}}
    {{sublist.item "Item Three b"}}
  {{/list.ul}}
  {{list.item "Item Four"}}
{{/uxs-ul}}

attributes.name: Accessible
attributes.description: A mixin to add accesibility attributes to a component

fields.name: disabled
fields.description: Prevents the action from firing when true

fields.name: label
fields.description: Sets the an aria-label attribute

fields.name: role
fields.description: Sets the role attribute

attributes.name: Alignable
attributes.description: Add text-align arguments to a component

fields.name: align
fields.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

attributes.name: Clickable
attributes.description: A mixin to add click support to a component.

fields.name: onClick
fields.description: The name of the action to fire on click

fields.name: role
fields.description: Add a role to the item for accessibility

attributes.name: Sizable
attributes.description: Add size modifier to a component

fields.name: size
fields.description: Define the size of the component. Standard options are "giant", "huge", "large", "medium", "small", or "tiny". Defaults to no size (inhered)

attributes.name: Testable
attributes.description:
A mixin to add ember test selectors to a component.

This mixin adds an attribute binding to the component to produce a test selector.

By default these attributes are removed in production builds

fields.name: style
fields.description:
Set the style of the component.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. --my-custom-style

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name property is used as the value for test selectors.
For example the foo-component would have the following selector:

{{foo-component name="bar"}}

[data-test-foo="bar"]

The default is true, which adds the attribute with no value.

If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

fields.name: testSelectorName
fields.description:
By default a components base property is used as the value for test selectors. e.g.

{{foo-component base="foo"}}

[data-test-foo]

If you want the test selector to differ you can set it's testSelectorName e.g

{{foo-component base="foo" testSelectorName="bar"}}

[data-test-bar]

attributes.name: Textable
attributes.description: A mixing to give a component text like functionality

fields.name: align
fields.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

fields.name: size
fields.description: Define the size of the component. Standard options are "giant", "huge", "large", "medium", "small", or "tiny". Defaults to no size (inhered)

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Define the weight of the component. Standard options are "bold", "medium" or "light". Defaults to no weight (inhered)

attributes.name: Weightable
attributes.description: Add weight argument to a component

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Define the weight of the component. Standard options are "bold", "medium" or "light". Defaults to no weight (inhered)
